body_html:
Thanks, it was indeed DenseNet for which the error occurred, but used in a different repo. I'm glad to see that the community has already responded with a workaround, I will have a look.

P.S. I found that this change was actually commited just six says ago, so everyone using an earlier version should be fine. And the change was actually introduced to improve backward compatibility by appending the version to the module name. What an irony. 😄

P.S. I found that this change was actually commited just six says ago, so everyone using an earlier version should be fine. And the change was actually introduced to improve backward compatibility by appending the version to the module name. What an irony. 😄
body:
Thanks, it was indeed DenseNet for which the error occurred, but used in a different repo. I'm glad to see that the community has already responded with a workaround, I will have a look.

P.S. I found that this change was actually commited [just six says ago](https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/commit/6a41e2dc4725470062de187eda00399c9bec0479#diff-527b04fec26e044c060ad28b22e842be), so everyone using an earlier version should be fine. And the change was actually introduced to _improve_ backward compatibility by appending the version to the module name. What an irony. :smile:
